text: 084853745 | COH | 21746069 | | 9877082 | 11/11/2006 12:00:00 AM | #asthma# exacerbation | | DIS | Admission Date: 2/12/2006 Report Status: Discharge Date: 11/10/2006 ****** FINAL DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** RUMBLE , LUPE 606-31-03-2 Washington Service: MED DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 5/23/06 AT 01:00 PM CONTINGENT UPON Not Applicable WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: KOETS , LEN D. , M.D. CODE STATUS: Full code DISPOSITION: Home DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: ALBUTEROL INHALER 2 PUFF INH QID ALBUTEROL NEBULIZER 2.5 MG NEB Q4H Starting Today ( 11/19 ) PRN Shortness of Breath , Wheezing ADVAIR DISKUS 500/50 ( FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE/... ) 1 PUFF INH BID COMBIVENT ( IPRATROPIUM AND ALBUTEROL SULFATE ) 2 PUFF INH TID LISINOPRIL 20 MG PO DAILY Override Notice: Override added on 10/24/06 by SICKEL , SON ORVILLE , M.D. on order for KCL IMMEDIATE RELEASE PO ( ref # 228268145 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: aware SINGULAIR ( MONTELUKAST ) 10 MG PO DAILY PREDNISONE Taper PO Give 60 mg q 24 h X 2 dose( s ) , then Give 50 mg q 24 h X 3 dose( s ) , then Give 40 mg q 24 h X 3 dose( s ) , then Give 30 mg q 24 h X 3 dose( s ) , then Give 20 mg q 24 h X 3 dose( s ) , then Give 10 mg q 24 h X 2 dose( s ) , then Starting IN AM ( 11/25 ) DIET: 2 gram Sodium ACTIVITY: Activity as tolerated FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Please arrange to see Dr. Minium by the end of the week. , ALLERGY: AMOX./CLAV.ACID 250/125 , Codeine ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: #asthma# exacerbation PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) #asthma# exacerbation OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay #asthma# ( #asthma# ) HTN ( hypertension ) #obese# ( #obese# ) HTN ( hypertension ) hyperglycemia on steriods ( elevated glucose ) hirsutism ( hirsutism ) spinal stenosis ( spinal stenosis ) LBP ( low back pain ) chiari malformation spinal syrinx C3-T2 ( 8 ) OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: none OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) none BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: 42 yo F w/ h/o #asthma# p/w SOB in setting of recent #asthma# flare ****************** Pt was in her USOH until 1wk PTA when experienced URI sx , productive cough and low grade fevers. Seen at Tasleyka Medical where rx'd with nebs , steroids and d/c'd on pred taper starting at 40mg qd. Pt was told that her CXR was c/w PNA. Also rx'd Z-pack which she has completed. Cough and URI sx have improved but she has had persistent DOE. Peak flow has been 150 , decreased from baseline of 300-350. Seen in TNH urgent care today where reportedly she was hypertensive and O2 sat 94-95% on RA , referred to OAKMA VALLEY HOSPITAL for #asthma# flare refractory to current treatment. No CP , HA or focal neurological deficits. Pt c/o +increased LE edema L>R , +orthopnea , and +PND. No sick contacts. **** ED: 97.4 p126 181/95 30 94% RA , CXR and EKG performed , rx'd prednisone 60mg x1 , nebs. ************** PMH: #asthma# - no h/o intubation , multiple admissions and courses of steroids , HTN , #obese# , Hyperlipidemia , Hyperglycemia - when on steroids , Hirsutism , Chiari Malformation - s/p decompression , Spinal Stenosis , Spinal Syrinx - C3-T2 , Low back pain - s/p multiple epidural steroid injections ************* MEDS: prednisone 30mg qd ( taper ) , advair , albuterol , combivent , singulair , lisinopril *********** EXAM: Afeb p104 199/104 rr25 96% 2L Pt appeared in mild respiratory distress , sitting up reading a book , very pleasant #obese# woman HEENT: JVP not elevated LUNGS: prolonged expiratory phase CVS: rrr , nl S1S2 , no m/g/r ABD: #obese# , BS+ , NT/ND EXT: TR to 1+ edema to mid calf bilat , L>R *************** LABS: WBC 14 STUDIES: EKG: sinus tach 104 CXR( : linear opacity in RLL most c/w platelike atelectasis but cannot r/o resolving or new PNA *************** HOSITAL COURSE: 42 yo F w/ #asthma# and tobacco use presents with #asthma# flare refractory to initial treatment * PULM: SOB most likely 2/2 reactive airway disease. Substantial smoking history raises question of COPD as contributor or dominant factor in her pulmonary disease. Pt was treated with duonebs q4h with Albuterol q2h prn. Pt was continued on advair , singulair. She was started on Prednisone 60 daily for 4 days and then slowy tapered. No abx at this time as she just completed course. WBC elevation likely 2/2 steroids. At D/C , peak flow had improved to 250 and ambulating O2 sat was 92-94%. Pt's breathing had significantly improved. Smoking cessation encouraged. Pt was interested in trying nicotine patch. * CV: PUMP: HTN: Lisinopril was increased to 20mg daily due to hypertension. No evidence of end-organ damage in w/u. UA neg for proteinuria. * PPX: lovenox CODE: full ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: 1. ) Continue all of your home medications. Your lisinopril was increased to 20mg daily. 2. ) Take prednisone 60mg daily for 2 days ( starting tomorrow ) , then 50mg daily x 3days , then 40mg daily x3 days , then 30mg daily x 3days , then 20mg daily x3 days , and then 10mg daily x2 days and stop. 3. ) Please arrnge to see Dr. Portune by the end of the week. She will advise you of any change in your prednisone taper. 4. ) Call Dr. Schmatz or come back to the emergency room if you experience worsening of your breathing or fever. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: ** Dr. Tremmel ** Please taper prednisone as tolerated by patient. No dictated summary ENTERED BY: DANIELS , BOB T ( MN92 ) 5/23/06 @ 12:40 PM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
